title: Poster, America Whistles, for Mobil, America: The Third Century, 1976
title_raw: America Whistles, for Mobil, America: The Third Century
medium: Offset lithograph on white wove paper
inscribed:
Imprinted in gray below title: America Whistles by Edward Ruscha: From a series commissioned by Mobil Oil Corporation for the Bicentennial. Recogonized by the American Revolution Bicentennial Administration.
Below image at lower left Text and logo for Mobil and at lower center across the sheet in black block letters:  Mobil:The Third Century.  Imprinted in black at lower left corner: Mobil above a star logo encircled by the text: American Revolution Bicentennial 1776-1976.
provenance: From the collection of Dan Friedman
description:
Against a white background the words "AMERICA WHISTLES" are presented as if drawn with red spray paint on a wall. Scatered over the image are many, tightly rendered musical notes in blue, green and orange. The image is enclosed in a beige border.
Title of original drawing is at bottom of image.  Below image at lower left text and logo for Mobil and at lower center across the sheet in gray block letters:  America:The Third Century

tombstone.epitaph:
Poster, America Whistles, for Mobil, America: The Third Century, 1976. Offset lithograph on white wove paper. 
Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-266
